Activity: Wake up, review the week's goals: data source research and data cleaning implementation.
Log in to the system, check emails. Prioritize urgent requests and flag items for follow-up.
Review existing data sources and documentation related to financial data (e.g., stock prices, options data, macroeconomic indicators). Identify gaps and potential new sources.
Research alternative data sources for potential arbitrage opportunities. Specifically, explore sentiment analysis data from news articles and social media.
Document findings on alternative data sources, including data availability, cost, and potential integration challenges.
Lunch break, browse research papers on statistical arbitrage strategies.
Begin drafting preliminary data cleaning procedures for the highest priority data source (e.g., stock prices). Define steps for handling missing data, outliers, and inconsistencies.
Implement a basic data cleaning script using Python and relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) for the selected data source. Focus on handling missing values and data type conversions.
Test the data cleaning script on a sample dataset and evaluate its effectiveness. Identify areas for improvement and potential edge cases.
Document the data cleaning script, including input requirements, output format, and any assumptions made.
